name: Denise Geiskkovitch
content: Denise Geiskkovitch Research and Design Hi, I'm Denise. I am an assistant professor in the Department of Computing and Software, and the Barber Gennum Chair in Information Technology at McMaster University. My research centres focuses on designing robot behaviours for meaninful interaction with adults and children. I am also interested in how unexpected robot behaviours (such as errors) impact human-robot interaction. Selected Projects (more recent projects here) Obedience to Robots Do people obey robots in positions of authority? Children's Trust Towards Robots Experiments exploring children's trust towards robot with different attributes. Human-Robot Proxemics Does seating arrangement affect perceptions of a robot? Icons for children User-centered design of app icons for children. Contact Me [emailÂ protected] http://www.linkedin.com/in/denisegeiskkovitch
